Since 2010, at least four tonic syrups have been released in the United States. Consumers add carbonated water to the syrup to make tonic water; this allows drinkers to vary the intensity of the flavour.

ingredients.name: Triple sec
ingredients.description:
Triple sec, originally Curaçao triple sec, is a variety of Curaçao liqueur, an orange-flavoured liqueur made from the dried peels of bitter and/or sweet oranges.

Triple sec may be consumed neat as a digestif or on the rocks, but it is more often used as an ingredient in a variety of cocktails, such as sangria, margarita, Kamikaze, White Lady, Long Island Iced Tea, Sidecar, Skittle Bomb, Corpse Reviver #2, and Cosmopolitan.

The Combier distillery claims that triple sec was invented between 1834 and 1848 by Jean-Baptiste Combier in Saumur, France. However, Combier was more famous for its élixir Combier, which contained orange and many other flavorings.

Cointreau, on the other hand, claims that its orange liqueur was formulated in 1849.

Triple sec was widely known by 1878: at the Exposition Universelle of 1878 in Paris, several distillers were offering "Curaçao [sic] triple sec", as well as "Curaçao doux".

ingredients.name: Vanilla Pods
ingredients.description: Vanilla pods contain seeds with intense vanilla flavor. Used to infuse syrups, creams, and spirits.

ingredients.name: Vermouth
ingredients.description:
Vermouth (/vərˈmuːθ/ ver-MOOTH; also UK: /ˈvɜːrməθ/;[1][2]) is an aromatized, fortified wine flavored with various botanicals (roots, barks, flowers, seeds, herbs, and spices).

The modern versions of the beverage were first produced in the mid to late 18th century in Turin, Italy. While vermouth was traditionally used for medicinal purposes, its true claim to fame is as an aperitif, with fashionable cafes in Turin serving it to guests around the clock. However, in the late 19th century it became popular with bartenders as a key ingredient in many classic cocktails that have survived to date, such as the Martini, the Manhattan, the Rob Roy, and the Negroni. In addition to being consumed as an aperitif or cocktail ingredient, vermouth is sometimes used as an alternative white wine in cooking.

Historically, there have been two main types of vermouth: sweet and dry. Responding to demand and competition, vermouth manufacturers have created additional styles, including extra-dry white, sweet white (bianco), red, amber (ambre or rosso), and rosé. Vermouth is produced by starting with a base of a neutral grape wine or unfermented wine must. Each manufacturer adds additional alcohol and a proprietary mixture of dry ingredients, consisting of aromatic herbs, roots, and barks, to the base wine, base wine plus spirit or spirit only – which may be redistilled before adding to the wine or unfermented wine must. After the wine is aromatized and fortified, the vermouth is sweetened with either cane sugar or caramelized sugar, depending on the style. Italian and French companies produce most of the vermouth consumed throughout the world, although the United States and the United Kingdom are also producers.

ingredients.name: Vodka
ingredients.description:
Vodka is a distilled beverage composed primarily of water and ethanol, sometimes with traces of impurities and flavorings. Traditionally, vodka is made by the distillation of fermented cereal grains or potatoes, though some modern brands use other substances, such as fruits or sugar.

Since the 1890s, the standard Polish, Russian, Belarusian, Ukrainian, Estonian, Latvian, Lithuanian and Czech vodkas are 40% alcohol by volume ABV (80 US proof), a percentage that is widely misattributed to Dmitri Mendeleev. The European Union has established a minimum of 37.5% ABV for any "European vodka" to be named as such. Products sold as "vodka" in the United States must have a minimum alcohol content of 40%. Even with these loose restrictions, most vodka sold contains 40% ABV. For homemade vodkas and distilled beverages referred to as "moonshine", see moonshine by country.

Vodka is traditionally drunk neat (not mixed with any water, ice, or other mixer), though it is often served chilled in the vodka belt countries (Belarus, Estonia, Finland, Iceland, Latvia, Lithuania, Norway, Poland, Russia, Sweden, Ukraine). It is also commonly used in cocktails and mixed drinks, such as the vodka martini, Cosmopolitan, vodka tonic, Screwdriver, Greyhound, Black or White Russian, Moscow Mule, and Bloody Mary.

Scholars debate the beginnings of vodka. It is a contentious issue because very little historical material is available. For many centuries, beverages differed significantly compared to the vodka of today, as the spirit at that time had a different flavor, color and smell, and was originally used as medicine. It contained little alcohol, an estimated maximum of about 14%, as only this amount can be attained by natural fermentation. The still, allowing for distillation ("burning of wine"), increased purity, and increased alcohol content, was invented in the 8th century.

A common property of the vodkas produced in the United States and Europe is the extensive use of filtration prior to any additional processing including the addition of flavorants. Filtering is sometimes done in the still during distillation, as well as afterwards, where the distilled vodka is filtered through activated charcoal and other media to absorb trace amounts of substances that alter or impart off-flavors to the vodka. However, this is not the case in the traditional vodka-producing nations, so many distillers from these countries prefer to use very accurate distillation but minimal filtering, thus preserving the unique flavors and characteristics of their products.

The master distiller is in charge of distilling the vodka and directing its filtration, which includes the removal of the "fore-shots", "heads" and "tails". These components of the distillate contain flavor compounds such as ethyl acetate and ethyl lactate (heads) as well as the fusel oils (tails) that impact the usually desired clean taste of vodka. Through numerous rounds of distillation, or the use of a fractioning still, the taste is modified and clarity is increased. In contrast, distillery process for liquors such as whiskey, rum, and baijiu allow portions of the "heads" and "tails" to remain, giving them their unique flavors.

Repeated distillation of vodka will make its ethanol level much higher than is acceptable to most end users, whether legislation determines strength limits or not. Depending on the distillation method and the technique of the stillmaster, the final filtered and distilled vodka may have as much as 95–96% ethanol. As such, most vodka is diluted with water prior to bottling.

Polish distilleries make a very pure (96%, 192 proof, formerly also 98%) rectified spirit (Polish language: spirytus rektyfikowany). Technically a form of vodka, it is sold in liquor stores rather than pharmacies. Similarly, the German market often carries German, Hungarian, Polish, and Ukrainian-made varieties of vodka of 90 to 95% ABV. A Bulgarian vodka, Balkan 176°, has an 88% alcohol content. Everclear, an American brand, is also sold at 95% ABV.

ingredients.name: Vodka Vanilla
ingredients.description: Vodka Vanilla is a vanilla-flavored vodka with 35–40% ABV. Great in dessert and coffee cocktails.

ingredients.name: Water
ingredients.description:
Water is a transparent and nearly colorless chemical substance that is the main constituent of Earth's streams, lakes, and oceans, and the fluids of most living organisms. Its chemical formula is H2O, meaning that its molecule contains one oxygen and two hydrogen atoms that are connected by covalent bonds. Strictly speaking, water refers to the liquid state of a substance that prevails at standard ambient temperature and pressure; but it often refers also to its solid state (ice) or its gaseous state (steam or water vapor). It also occurs in nature as snow, glaciers, ice packs and icebergs, clouds, fog, dew, aquifers, and atmospheric humidity.

Water covers 71% of the Earth's surface.[1] It is vital for all known forms of life. On Earth, 96.5% of the planet's crust water is found in seas and oceans, 1.7% in groundwater, 1.7% in glaciers and the ice caps of Antarctica and Greenland, a small fraction in other large water bodies, 0.001% in the air as vapor, clouds (formed of ice and liquid water suspended in air), and precipitation. Only 2.5% of this water is freshwater, and 98.8% of that water is in ice (excepting ice in clouds) and groundwater. Less than 0.3% of all freshwater is in rivers, lakes, and the atmosphere, and an even smaller amount of the Earth's freshwater (0.003%) is contained within biological bodies and manufactured products. A greater quantity of water is found in the earth's interior.

Water on Earth moves continually through the water cycle of evaporation and transpiration (evapotranspiration), condensation, precipitation, and runoff, usually reaching the sea. Evaporation and transpiration contribute to the precipitation over land. Large amounts of water are also chemically combined or adsorbed in hydrated minerals.

Safe drinking water is essential to humans and other lifeforms even though it provides no calories or organic nutrients. Access to safe drinking water has improved over the last decades in almost every part of the world, but approximately one billion people still lack access to safe water and over 2.5 billion lack access to adequate sanitation. There is a clear correlation between access to safe water and gross domestic product per capita. However, some observers have estimated that by 2025 more than half of the world population will be facing water-based vulnerability. A report, issued in November 2009, suggests that by 2030, in some developing regions of the world, water demand will exceed supply by 50%.

Water plays an important role in the world economy. Approximately 70% of the freshwater used by humans goes to agriculture. Fishing in salt and fresh water bodies is a major source of food for many parts of the world. Much of long-distance trade of commodities (such as oil and natural gas) and manufactured products is transported by boats through seas, rivers, lakes, and canals. Large quantities of water, ice, and steam are used for cooling and heating, in industry and homes. Water is an excellent solvent for a wide variety of chemical substances; as such it is widely used in industrial processes, and in cooking and washing. Water is also central to many sports and other forms of entertainment, such as swimming, pleasure boating, boat racing, surfing, sport fishing, and diving.

ingredients.name: Whipped cream
ingredients.description:
Whipped cream is cream that is whipped by a whisk or mixer until it is light and fluffy. Whipped cream is often sweetened and sometimes flavored with vanilla. Whipped cream is often called Chantilly cream or crème Chantilly (pronounced [kʁɛm ʃɑ̃tiji]).

Whipped cream is an aerated colloid produced when air is incorporated into cream containing at least 35% fat. During whipping, partially coalesced fat molecules create a stabilized network which traps air bubbles. The resulting colloid is roughly double the volume of the original cream. If, however, the whipping is continued, the fat droplets will stick together destroying the colloid and forming butter. Lower-fat cream (or milk) does not whip well, while higher-fat cream produces a more stable foam.

Cream is usually whipped with a whisk, an electric or hand mixer, or a food processor. Results are best when the equipment and ingredients are cold.

Whipped cream is often flavored with sugar, vanilla, coffee, chocolate, orange, and so on. Many 19th-century recipes recommend adding gum tragacanth to stabilize whipped cream; a few include whipped egg whites. Various other substances, including gelatin and diphosphate (E450), are used in commercial stabilizers.

Whipped cream may also be made in a whipping siphon, typically using nitrous oxide as the gas, as carbon dioxide tends to give a sour taste.[10] The siphon may have replaceable cartridges or be sold as a pre-pressurized retail package. The gas dissolves in the butterfat under pressure, and when the pressure is released, produces bubbles and thus whipped cream.

ingredients.name: Whisky
ingredients.description:
Whisky or whiskey is a type of distilled alcoholic beverage made from fermented grain mash. Various grains (which may be malted) are used for different varieties, including barley, corn (maize), rye, and wheat. Whisky is typically aged in wooden casks, generally made of charred white oak.

Whisky is a strictly regulated spirit worldwide with many classes and types. The typical unifying characteristics of the different classes and types are the fermentation of grains, distillation, and aging in wooden barrels.

The word whisky (or whiskey) is an anglicisation of the Classical Gaelic word uisce (or uisge) meaning "water" (now written as uisce in Irish Gaelic, and uisge in Scottish Gaelic). Distilled alcohol was known in Latin as aqua vitae ("water of life"). This was translated to Classical Gaelic as Irish: uisce beatha/Scottish Gaelic: uisge beatha "water of life". Early forms of the word in English included uskebeaghe (1581), usquebaugh (1610), usquebath (1621), and usquebae (1715).

It is possible that distillation was practised by the Babylonians in Mesopotamia in the 2nd millennium BC, with perfumes and aromatics being distilled, but this is subject to uncertain and disputed interpretation of evidence. The earliest certain chemical distillations were by Greeks in Alexandria in the 1st century AD, but these were not distillations of alcohol. The medieval Arabs adopted the distillation technique of the Alexandrian Greeks, and written records in Arabic begin in the 9th century, but again these were not distillations of alcohol. Distilling technology passed from the medieval Arabs to the medieval Latins, with the earliest records in Latin in the early 12th century. The earliest records of the distillation of alcohol are in Italy in the 13th century, where alcohol was distilled from wine. An early description of the technique was given by Ramon Llull (1232 – 1315). Its use spread through medieval monasteries, largely for medicinal purposes, such as the treatment of colic and smallpox.

The art of distillation spread to Ireland and Scotland no later than the 15th century, as did the common European practice of distilling "aqua vitae" or spirit alcohol primarily for medicinal purposes. The practice of medicinal distillation eventually passed from a monastic setting to the secular via professional medical practitioners of the time, The Guild of Barber Surgeons. The earliest Irish mention of whisky comes from the seventeenth-century Annals of Clonmacnoise, which attributes the death of a chieftain in 1405 to "taking a surfeit of aqua vitae" at Christmas. In Scotland, the first evidence of whisky production comes from an entry in the Exchequer Rolls for 1494 where malt is sent "To Friar John Cor, by order of the king, to make aquavitae", enough to make about 500 bottles.

A still for making whisky is usually made of copper, since it removes sulfur-based compounds from the alcohol that would make it unpleasant to drink. Modern stills are made of stainless steel with copper innards (piping, for example, will be lined with copper along with copper plate inlays along still walls). The simplest standard distillation apparatus is commonly known as a pot still, consisting of a single heated chamber and a vessel to collect purified alcohol.

Column stills are frequently used in the production of grain whisky and are the most commonly used type of still in the production of bourbon and other American whiskeys. Column stills behave like a series of single pot stills, formed in a long vertical tube. Whereas a single pot still charged with wine might yield a vapour enriched to 40–50% alcohol, a column still can achieve a vapour alcohol content of 95.6%; an azeotropic mixture of alcohol and water.

ingredients.name: White Creme de Menthe
ingredients.description: Crème de menthe (pronounced [kʁɛm də mɑ̃t], French for "mint cream") is a sweet, mint-flavored alcoholic beverage. It is available commercially in a colorless version (called "white") and a green version (colored by the mint leaves or by added coloring if made from extract instead of leaves).

ingredients.name: White Rum
ingredients.description: Light rums, also referred to as "silver" or "white" rums, in general, have very little flavor aside from a general sweetness. Light rums are sometimes filtered after aging to remove any colour. The majority of light rums come from Puerto Rico. Their milder flavors make them popular for use in mixed drinks, as opposed to drinking them straight. Light rums are included in some of the most popular cocktails including the Mojito and the Daiquiri.

ingredients.name: White Wine
ingredients.description:
Wine (from Latin vinum) is an alcoholic beverage made from grapes, generally Vitis vinifera, fermented without the addition of sugars, acids, enzymes, water, or other nutrients.

Yeast consumes the sugar in the grapes and converts it to ethanol and carbon dioxide. Different varieties of grapes and strains of yeasts produce different styles of wine. These variations result from the complex interactions between the biochemical development of the grape, the reactions involved in fermentation, the terroir, and the production process. Many countries enact legal appellations intended to define styles and qualities of wine. These typically restrict the geographical origin and permitted varieties of grapes, as well as other aspects of wine production. Wines not made from grapes include rice wine and fruit wines such as plum, cherry, pomegranate and elderberry.

Wine has been produced for thousands of years. The earliest known traces of wine are from China (c. 7000 BC), Georgia (c. 6000 BC), Iran (c. 5000 BC), and Sicily (c. 4000 BC). The earliest known winery is the 6,100-year-old Areni-1 winery in Armenia. Wine reached the Balkans by 4500 BC and was consumed and celebrated in ancient Greece, Thrace and Rome. Throughout history, wine has been consumed for its intoxicating effects.

Wine has long played an important role in religion. Red wine was associated with blood by the ancient Egyptians and was used by both the Greek cult of Dionysus and the Romans in their Bacchanalia; Judaism also incorporates it in the Kiddush and Christianity in the Eucharist.

ingredients.name: Wild Turkey
ingredients.description:
Wild Turkey is a brand of Kentucky straight bourbon whiskey distilled and bottled by the Austin Nichols division of Campari Group. The distillery is located near Lawrenceburg, Kentucky, United States. It offers tours, and is part of the American Whiskey Trail and the Kentucky Bourbon Trail.

In 1891, Thomas Ripy built the Old Hickory Distillery in Tyrone, Kentucky, near Lawrenceburg, on the former site of the Old Moore Distillery. After Prohibition, the Ripy family (Thomas had died in 1902) repaired the distillery and began to again produce bourbon. The Ripys sold the bourbon produced at this distillery to various wholesalers who bottled bourbon under their own brands. Austin Nichols was one of these wholesalers.

The "Wild Turkey" brand is said to have arisen after an Austin Nichols executive, Thomas McCarthy, took some warehouse samples on a wild turkey hunting trip in 1940. The bourbon proved so popular among his friends they continued to ask him for "that wild turkey bourbon." Austin Nichols began to bottle Wild Turkey in 1942.

The Ripys were bought out in 1949 by Robert and Alvin Gould.

For three decades after introducing Wild Turkey, Austin Nichols remained a non-distiller producer—bottling bourbon purchased on the open market under their Wild Turkey brand. Much of this whiskey was purchased from the Ripys/Gould distillery in Tyrone. In 1971, Austin Nichols purchased the facility (then known as the Boulevard Distillery) and changed the name to the Wild Turkey Distillery.

In 1980, the distillery and the Wild Turkey brand were purchased by Pernod Ricard.

On May 9, 2000, a fire destroyed a seven-story aging warehouse at the company in Anderson County, Kentucky. It contained more than 17,000 wooden barrels of whiskey. Burning whiskey flowed from the warehouse, setting the woods on fire, causing limestone deposits to explode. Firefighters saved Lawrenceburg's water treatment plant from destruction. However, an estimated 20% of the whiskey flowed into the Kentucky River. The river contamination required the temporary shutdown of the water treatment plant. Officials ordered water usage restrictions. Businesses and schools were closed because of the water shortage. The alcohol spill also depleted the oxygen in the river, killing an estimated 228,000 fish along a 66-mile stretch. The EPA and the Coast Guard's Gulf Strike Team aerated the river using equipment mounted on barges.[6] The company paid $256,000 to the Kentucky Department of Fish and Wildlife in an effort to restore the fish population in the river.

In 2009, the Campari Group acquired the distillery and the Wild Turkey brand from Pernod Ricard.

In 2011, Wild Turkey began to be distilled at a newly constructed facility near the old distillery. The new distillery sits where the old bottling facility was previously located.

In 2013, Campari opened a new bottling facility at the Wild Turkey Distillery. For the previous 13 years Wild Turkey had been bottled offsite in Indiana and, later, Arkansas. In addition to the Wild Turkey products, Campari's SKYY vodka is also bottled there after being shipped from the Illinois distillery.

ingredients.name: Wine
ingredients.description:
Wine (from Latin vinum) is an alcoholic beverage made from grapes, generally Vitis vinifera, fermented without the addition of sugars, acids, enzymes, water, or other nutrients.

Yeast consumes the sugar in the grapes and converts it to ethanol and carbon dioxide. Different varieties of grapes and strains of yeasts produce different styles of wine. These variations result from the complex interactions between the biochemical development of the grape, the reactions involved in fermentation, the terroir, and the production process. Many countries enact legal appellations intended to define styles and qualities of wine. These typically restrict the geographical origin and permitted varieties of grapes, as well as other aspects of wine production. Wines not made from grapes include rice wine and fruit wines such as plum, cherry, pomegranate and elderberry.

Wine has been produced for thousands of years. The earliest known traces of wine are from China (c. 7000 BC), Georgia (c. 6000 BC), Iran (c. 5000 BC), and Sicily (c. 4000 BC). The earliest known winery is the 6,100-year-old Areni-1 winery in Armenia. Wine reached the Balkans by 4500 BC and was consumed and celebrated in ancient Greece, Thrace and Rome. Throughout history, wine has been consumed for its intoxicating effects.

Wine has long played an important role in religion. Red wine was associated with blood by the ancient Egyptians and was used by both the Greek cult of Dionysus and the Romans in their Bacchanalia; Judaism also incorporates it in the Kiddush and Christianity in the Eucharist.

ingredients.name: Worcestershire Sauce
ingredients.description:
Worcestershire sauce (/ˈwʊstərʃər/ (About this sound listen)), (Merriam-Webster: \ˈwu̇s-tə(r)-ˌshir-, -shər- also -ˌshī(-ə)r-\ ), frequently shortened to Worcester sauce (/ˈwʊstər/)[citation needed], is a fermented liquid condiment of complex mixture originally created by the Worcester chemists John Wheeley Lea and William Henry Perrins, who went on to form the company Lea & Perrins. The ingredients are allowed to mature for 18 months before being blended and bottled in Worcester, where the exact recipe is kept a secret.

Lea and Perrins devised the recipe in the 1830s, however it was not to their liking and was set aside and forgotten about. It was not until the barrels were rediscovered many months later that the taste had mellowed into what is now known as Worcestershire sauce. A high court decided on 26 July 1876 that Lea & Perrins did not have the rights to the term Worcestershire sauce, and so the name is not trademarked. Lea & Perrins claims to be The Original Worcestershire sauce and may be the leading global brand of Worcestershire sauce[citation needed], but other brands offer similar recipes. Some may be vegetarian or vegan, and may add other spices.

Worcestershire sauce is complex and unique in its flavour and aroma, and frequently used to enhance some food and drink recipes. For example, it is often an ingredient in Welsh rarebit, Caesar salad, Oysters Kirkpatrick, deviled eggs, and sometimes an ingredient in chili con carne, beef stew or other beef dishes. The sauce is also used to flavour cocktails such as the Bloody Mary or Caesar.

ingredients.name: Yellow Chartreuse
ingredients.description:
Chartreuse (pronounced [ʃaʁtʁøz]) is a French liqueur made by the Carthusian Monks since 1737 according to the instructions set out in a manuscript given to them by François Annibal d'Estrées in 1605. It is composed of distilled alcohol aged with 130 herbs, plants and flowers. The liqueur is named after the monks' Grande Chartreuse monastery, located in the Chartreuse Mountains in the general region of Grenoble in France. The liqueur is produced in their distillery in the nearby town of Voiron (Isère). Until the 1980s, there was another distillery at Tarragona in Spain.

Chartreuse gives its name to the color chartreuse, which was first used as a term of color in 1884. It is one of the handful of liquors that continue to age and improve in the bottle.

ingredients.name: Yoghurt
ingredients.description:
Yogurt, yoghurt, or yoghourt (/ˈjoʊɡərt/ or /ˈjɒɡət/; from Turkish: yoğurt; other spellings listed below) is a food produced by bacterial fermentation of milk.[1] The bacteria used to make yogurt are known as "yogurt cultures". Fermentation of lactose by these bacteria produces lactic acid, which acts on milk protein to give yogurt its texture and characteristic tart flavor. Cow's milk is commonly available worldwide, and, as such, is the milk most commonly used to make yogurt. Milk from water buffalo, goats, ewes, mares, camels, and yaks is also used to produce yogurt where available locally. Milk used may be homogenized or not (milk distributed in many parts of the world is homogenized); both types may be used, with substantially different results.

Yogurt is produced using a culture of Lactobacillus delbrueckii subsp. bulgaricus and Streptococcus thermophilus bacteria. In addition, other lactobacilli and bifidobacteria are also sometimes added during or after culturing yogurt. Some countries require yogurt to contain a certain amount of colony-forming units of bacteria; in China, for example, the requirement for the number of lactobacillus bacteria is at least 1 × 106 CFU per milliliter.

To produce yogurt, milk is first heated, usually to about 85 °C (185 °F), to denature the milk proteins so that they do not form curds. After heating, the milk is allowed to cool to about 45 °C (113 °F). The bacterial culture is mixed in, and a temperature of 45 °C (113 °F) is maintained for four to twelve hours to allow fermentation.

ingredients.name: Yukon Jack
ingredients.description:
Yukon Jack is a liqueur advertised as the "Black sheep of Canadian Liquors". It is a 100 proof (in USA) or 80 proof (in Canada) drink, made from Canadian whisky and honey. The taste is sweeter than straight whisky and bourbon, due to the honey that is added.

Yukon Jack was formerly imported to the USA by Heublein Inc. Heublein was later taken over by Diageo.

Yukon Jack has been selected as the regimental liqueur of the South Alberta Light Horse. This commemorates the stationing in Whitehorse, Yukon in the 1950s of one unit of the regiment's predecessor, the 19th Alberta Dragoons.

ingredients.name: Zima
ingredients.description: Zima Clearmalt is a clear, lightly carbonated alcoholic beverage, that was made and distributed by the Coors Brewing Company. Introduced in 1993, it was marketed as an alternative to beer, an example of what is now often referred to as a cooler, with 4.7%–5.4% alcohol by volume. Its production in the United States ceased in October 2008, but it is still marketed in Japan. MillerCoors announced on June 2, 2017 that there would be a limited release of Zima. It is currently for sale for a limited time. Due to the success of the 2017 rerelease, it is likely MillerCoor will be bringing the drink back for summer 2018, but in much larger quantities.

ingredients.name: Zubrowka
ingredients.description: Żubrówka is a Polish bison grass vodka with 37–40% ABV. It has a unique herbal, vanilla-like aroma.

cocktails.name: 110 in the shade
cocktails.instructions:
Drop shooter in glass
Fill with beer

cocktails.name: 151 Florida Bushwacker
cocktails.instructions:
Combine all ingredients
Blend until smooth
Garnish with chocolate shavings if desired

cocktails.name: 155 Belmont
cocktails.instructions:
Blend with ice
Serve in a wine glass
Garnish with carrot

cocktails.name: 20th Century Cocktail
cocktails.description: A gin sour enriched with Lillet Blanc and white crème de cacao, balanced by fresh lemon. Silky, citrusy, with a hint of chocolate.
cocktails.instructions:
Add gin, Lillet Blanc, white crème de cacao, and lemon juice to a shaker with ice.
Shake until well-chilled.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

cocktails.name: 501 Blue
cocktails.instructions: Mix equal amounts into a glass with ice

cocktails.name: 57 Chevy with a White License Plate
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a rocks glass with ice 
2. Add white creme de cacao and vodka
3. Stir

cocktails.description: A simple highball of Seagram's 7 Crown whiskey topped with 7-Up. Effervescent and easy-drinking.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a highball glass with ice.
Pour in Seagram's 7 Crown whiskey.
Top with 7-Up and stir gently.
Garnish with a lemon wedge.

cocktails.name: 9 1/2 Weeks
cocktails.instructions:
Combine all ingredients in glass mixer
Chill and strain into Cocktail glass
Garnish with sliced strawberry

cocktails.name: A. J.
cocktails.instructions: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve

cocktails.name: A1
cocktails.instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker, mix and serve over ice into a chilled glass

cocktails.name: ABC
cocktails.description: A layered shooter of amaretto, Baileys, and cognac. Sweet, creamy, and smooth.
cocktails.instructions:
Pour amaretto into a shot glass.
Layer Baileys over the back of a bar spoon.
Top with cognac.
Serve immediately.

cocktails.name: Abilene
cocktails.instructions:
Pour all of the ingredients into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes
Stir well

cocktails.name: Acapulco
cocktails.description: A tropical mix of rum, tequila, and pineapple brightened with citrus.
cocktails.instructions:
Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice.
Shake until well-chilled.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a pineapple wedge.

cocktails.name: Ace
cocktails.instructions: Shake all the ingredients in a cocktail shaker and ice then strain in a cold glass

cocktails.name: Adam
cocktails.instructions:
In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients
Shake well
Strain into a cocktail glass

cocktails.name: Addington
cocktails.instructions:
Mix both the vermouth's in a shaker and strain into a cold glass
Top up with a squirt of Soda Water

cocktails.name: Addison
cocktails.instructions: Shake together all the ingredients and strain into a cold glass

cocktails.name: Adonis
cocktails.description: A graceful, low-alcohol aperitivo blending fino sherry and sweet vermouth, with a few dashes of orange bitters for aromatic depth. Smooth, nutty, and elegant.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a cocktail glass (e.g., coupe).
Add sherry, sweet vermouth and orange bitters into a mixing glass filled with ice.
Stir until well chilled and properly diluted.
Strain into the chilled glass.
Express orange peel oils over the drink and garnish with the twist.

cocktails.name: Adriatique
cocktails.description: A simple, elegant amaro-based aperitif—bittersweet, herbal, and smooth.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a mixing glass with ice.
Add Amaro Nonino and stir until chilled.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

cocktails.name: Affair
cocktails.instructions:
Pour schnapps, orange juice, and cranberry juice over ice in a highball glass
Top with club soda and serve

cocktails.name: Affinity
cocktails.instructions:
In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients
Stir well
Strain into a cocktail glass

cocktails.name: Afterglow
cocktails.instructions:
Mix
Serve over ice

cocktails.name: Agavoni
cocktails.description: A Mexican twist on the Negroni, replacing gin with tequila for an earthy, smoky depth.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a rocks glass with ice.
Pour in tequila, Campari, and vermouth.
Stir gently.
Garnish with an orange slice.

cocktails.name: Alabama Slammer
cocktails.description: A sweet and fruity Southern classic blending amaretto, sloe gin, Southern Comfort, and orange juice—smooth with a gentle warmth.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a highball glass with ice.
Add amaretto, sloe gin, Southern Comfort, and orange juice.
Stir gently to combine.
Garnish with an orange slice.

cocktails.name: Alexander
cocktails.description: A creamy, chocolate-infused brandy cocktail with velvety texture and indulgent flavor. Equal parts cognac (or brandy), crème de cacao, and cream create a luxurious sipper. Smooth, rich, and dessert-like.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Cocktail glass.
Shake all ingredients with ice until well-chilled and creamy.
Strain into the chilled glass.
No garnish required.

cocktails.name: Alexander's Brother
cocktails.description: A chocolate-mint twist on the Alexander, with crème de menthe adding a cool herbal freshness to the creamy mix.
cocktails.instructions:
Add brandy, crème de cacao, crème de menthe, and cream to a shaker with ice.
Shake until chilled and smooth.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

cocktails.name: Alexander's Sister
cocktails.description: A fresh, minty variant of the Alexander, replacing crème de cacao with crème de menthe for a lighter, herbal sweetness.
cocktails.instructions:
Shake gin, crème de menthe, and cream with ice until frothy and cold.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

cocktails.name: Algonquin
cocktails.instructions: Combine and shake all ingredients with ice, strain contents into a cocktail glass, and serve

cocktails.name: Alien Brain Hemorrhage
cocktails.description: A visually striking layered shooter with peach schnapps, Baileys, blue curaçao, and grenadine—sweet, creamy, and a little eerie.
cocktails.instructions:
Pour peach schnapps into a shot glass.
Slowly layer Baileys over the schnapps.
Drizzle blue curaçao on top, allowing it to sink.
Add grenadine, which will swirl through to create the 'brain' effect.

cocktails.name: Allegheny
cocktails.instructions:
Shake all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass
Top with the twist of lemon peel and serve

cocktails.name: Almeria
cocktails.instructions:
In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients
Shake well
Strain into a cocktail glass

cocktails.name: Almond Joy
cocktails.description: A dessert-style cocktail inspired by the candy bar, blending amaretto, dark crème de cacao, and cream—sweet, nutty, and chocolatey.
cocktails.instructions:
Shake amaretto, crème de cacao, and cream with ice until smooth.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

cocktails.name: Almond Old Fashioned
cocktails.description: Bourbon enriched with amaretto for a nutty twist on the classic Old Fashioned.
cocktails.instructions:
Combine bourbon, amaretto, Simple Syrup, and bitters in a mixing glass with ice.
Stir until well-chilled.
Strain over fresh ice in a rocks glass.
Express and garnish with an orange peel.

cocktails.name: Amaretto Sour
cocktails.description: Sweet almond liqueur balanced by lemon, optionally enriched with egg white. Soft, creamy, and dessert-like yet bright. A gateway sour beloved by many.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Rocks glass.
Dry shake if using egg, then add ice and shake again.
Strain over fresh ice.
Optional lemon wheel garnish.

cocktails.name: Amaro Paloma
cocktails.description: A bittersweet Paloma variation adding Campari to tequila and grapefruit.
cocktails.instructions:
Build tequila, Campari, lime juice, agave, and grapefruit juice in a highball glass with ice.
Top with soda and stir gently.
Garnish with a grapefruit wedge.

cocktails.name: Ambassador
cocktails.description: A rich mix of bourbon, Dubonnet, and orange liqueur with a bitters edge.
cocktails.instructions:
Combine bourbon, Dubonnet, Cointreau, and bitters with ice in a mixing glass.
Stir until chilled.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with an orange peel.

cocktails.name: Americano
cocktails.description: A lighter sibling of the Negroni that swaps gin for soda. Bitter and aromatic with a lively fizz. Ideal as an afternoon aperitif.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Highball glass.
Add Campari and sweet vermouth over ice.
Top with soda and briefly stir.
Garnish with an orange slice.

cocktails.name: AMF
cocktails.description: Also known as the Adios Motherfucker, this electric-blue Long Island riff packs vodka, rum, tequila, gin, and citrus.
cocktails.instructions:
Add vodka, rum, tequila, gin, blue curaçao, and sour mix to a shaker with ice.
Shake briefly and strain into a highball glass filled with ice.
Top with 7-Up and gently stir.
Garnish with a lemon wedge.

cocktails.name: Angel Face
cocktails.description: A potent and fragrant mix of gin, apricot brandy, and calvados (apple brandy). Its fruit-forward nature is lifted by apple notes and a sharp gin backbone. Elegant, strong, and subtly fruity.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Cocktail glass.
Shake all ingredients with ice until cold.
Strain into the chilled glass.
No garnish required.

cocktails.name: Angel's Kiss
cocktails.description: A sweet, layered shooter with dark crème de cacao, cream, and cherry brandy—rich and dessert-like.
cocktails.instructions:
Layer crème de cacao, cream, and cherry brandy in a shot glass.
Serve immediately.

cocktails.name: Angel's Tit
cocktails.description: A playful layered shooter combining maraschino liqueur and cream, topped with a cherry.
cocktails.instructions:
Layer maraschino liqueur and cream in a shot glass.
Top with a cherry.

cocktails.name: Apello
cocktails.instructions:
Stirr
Grnish with maraschino cherry

cocktails.name: Aperitivo Sbagliato
cocktails.description: A ‘mistaken’ Negroni where sparkling wine replaces gin. Bitter-sweet, bubbly, and low in alcohol. A crowd‑friendly spritz for any occasion.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Wine glass.
Build Campari and sweet vermouth over ice.
Top with prosecco and give a gentle stir.
Garnish with an orange slice.

cocktails.name: Aperol Spritz
cocktails.description: Bubbly, bittersweet, and low in alcohol, this is the icon of Italian aperitivo. Aperol’s orange-herbal profile is lifted by prosecco and a splash of soda. It’s bright, refreshing, and perfect before dinner.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Wine glass.
Add Aperol, then prosecco, and a splash of soda over ice.
Give a gentle stir to combine without losing bubbles.
Garnish with an orange slice.

cocktails.name: Apple Martini
cocktails.description: A crisp, modern martini riff emphasizing green-apple tang. Vodka keeps it clean while apple liqueur adds fruit and color. Zesty, bright, and unmistakably contemporary.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Cocktail glass.
Shake vodka, apple liqueur, and lemon juice with ice.
Fine strain into the chilled glass.
Optional thin apple slice garnish.

cocktails.name: Applecar
cocktails.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve

cocktails.name: Artillery
cocktails.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve

cocktails.name: AT&T
cocktails.instructions: Pour Vodka and Gin over ice, add Tonic and Stir

cocktails.name: Avalanche
cocktails.instructions: Mix in highball glass over ice, shake well

cocktails.name: Avalon
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a tall glass with ice
Layer the Finlandia Vodka, lemon and apple juices, Pisang Ambon, and top up with lemonade
Stir slightly and garnish with a spiralled cucumber skin and a red cherry
The cucumber provides zest and looks attractive
This drink, created by Timo Haimi, took first prize in the 1991 Finlandia Vodka Long Drink Competition

cocktails.name: Aviation
cocktails.description: A floral gin sour with maraschino and violette for a delicate, perfumed lift. Pastel and aromatic with a brisk lemon core. A vintage beauty revived.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Cocktail glass.
Shake all ingredients with ice.
Fine strain into the chilled glass.
No garnish required.

cocktails.name: B-52
cocktails.description: A layered shooter showcasing coffee, cream, and orange notes. Precise pours form neat stripes in the glass. Sweet, creamy, and a party favorite.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Shooter glass.
Layer coffee liqueur, then Irish cream over the back of a spoon.
Finish with Grand Marnier as the top layer.
Serve immediately.

cocktails.name: B-53
cocktails.instructions:
Layer the Kahlua, Sambucca and Grand Marnier into a shot glas in that order
Better than B-52

cocktails.name: B-55
cocktails.description: A bold layered shot—coffee liqueur, Irish cream, and absinthe—delivering rich coffee, creamy sweetness, and a warming anise finish.
cocktails.instructions:
Select a chilled shooter glass.
Carefully layer the coffee liqueur into the glass.
Using the back of a spoon, gently layer the Irish cream over the coffee liqueur.
Finally, layer the absinthe on top using the spoon.
Serve immediately to appreciate the distinct layers.

cocktails.name: Baby Eskimo
cocktails.instructions:
Leave ice-cream out for about 10 minutes
Add ingredients in order, stir with chopstick (butter knife or spoon works too)
Consume immediately and often
Nice and light, great for following a heavy drink

cocktails.name: Baby Guinness
cocktails.description: A playful layered shooter that mimics a mini-pint of stout: coffee liqueur base topped with a creamy Irish cream 'head', sweet and smooth.
cocktails.instructions:
Select a chilled shooter glass.
Pour coffee liqueur into the glass to fill roughly three-quarters.
Slowly layer chilled Irish cream over the back of a spoon so it floats on top, resembling a stout’s head.
Serve immediately and enjoy the visual fun.

cocktails.name: Bacardi Cocktail
cocktails.description: A classic rum sour colored and flavored with grenadine. Bright lime keeps it taut while pomegranate adds a rosy, fruity edge. Clean, zesty, and historically iconic.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Cocktail glass.
Shake all ingredients hard with ice.
Fine strain into the chilled glass.
Serve without garnish.

cocktails.name: Bahama Mama
cocktails.description: A tropical, fruity blend of rum, coffee liqueur, and fruit juices—sweet, colorful, and perfect for summer.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a shaker with ice and add all ingredients.
Shake until chilled.
Strain into a hurricane glass over fresh ice.

cocktails.name: Balmoral
cocktails.instructions:
In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients
Stir well
Strain into a cocktail glass

cocktails.name: Bamboo
cocktails.description: A refined dry-style aperitivo of equal parts dry sherry and dry vermouth, lifted with both orange and Angostura bitters. Crisp, herbal, and balanced—light but far from bland.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a cocktail glass (e.g., coupe or Nick & Nora).
Add dry sherry, dry vermouth, Angostura bitters and orange bitters to a mixing glass with ice.
Stir until well chilled and slightly diluted.
Strain into the chilled glass.
Express a lemon peel over the drink and garnish with the twist (or optional olive).

cocktails.name: Bamboo (classic)
cocktails.description: A dry, wine-based sipper with sherry and vermouth balanced by bitters and a lemon twist—light, elegant, and aperitif-style.
cocktails.instructions:
Stir sherry, vermouth, and bitters with ice until chilled.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Express a lemon twist over the drink and use as garnish.

cocktails.name: Banana Calling
cocktails.description: A tropical-inspired twist on the classic 'London Calling', mixing gin and sherry with banana liqueur for a fruity, slightly nutty and balanced cocktail.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and chill a cocktail glass.
Add all liquid ingredients to a shaker filled with ice.
Shake well until the mixture is thoroughly chilled.
Double strain into the chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon peel.

cocktails.name: Banana Colada
cocktails.description: A creamy, tropical blend of rum, banana, coconut cream and pineapple juice—rich and indulgent, perfect for warm weather.
cocktails.instructions:
Add all ingredients except garnishes to a blender with a scoop of crushed ice.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a chilled hurricane glass.
Garnish with a pineapple wedge and cherry.

cocktails.name: Banana Daiquiri
cocktails.description: A tropical twist on the classic daiquiri with ripe banana, rum, lime juice, and sugar—smooth and fruity.
cocktails.instructions:
Blend banana, rum, lime juice, simple syrup, and ice until smooth.
Pour into a chilled cocktail glass.

cocktails.name: Banana Fantasy
cocktails.description: A tropical, creamy blend of banana, rum, and coconut syrup—smooth and sweet with a laid-back beach-vibe.
cocktails.instructions:
Blend banana, rum, and coconut syrup with ice until smooth.
Strain into a hurricane glass filled with fresh ice.
Optionally garnish with a banana slice or tropical fruit.

cocktails.name: Banana Flash
cocktails.description: A lively tropical mix of banana and coconut flavours balanced with pineapple juice and a touch of citrus, served long over ice.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a shaker with ice and add all liquid ingredients.
Shake well until chilled.
Strain into a hurricane glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a pineapple wedge and cherry.

cocktails.name: Banshee
cocktails.description: A creamy, dessert-style cocktail combining banana and chocolate liqueurs with fresh cream for a smooth, sweet treat.
cocktails.instructions:
Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice.
Shake until well chilled and creamy.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a banana slice.

cocktails.name: Barbarella
cocktails.description: A vibrant, fruity mix of apricot brandy, orange juice, and grenadine with a tropical sweetness and a soft citrus tang.
cocktails.instructions:
Add all ingredients to a shaker filled with ice.
Shake well until chilled.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with an orange wedge and cherry.

cocktails.name: Barracuda
cocktails.description: A tropical sparkler marrying rum, Galliano, pineapple, and lime, topped with prosecco. Vanilla-herbal depth meets juicy fruit and bubbles. Vibrant, aromatic, and party-ready.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Hurricane glass.
Shake rum, Galliano, pineapple, and lime with ice.
Strain into the glass over ice.
Top with prosecco and serve.

cocktails.name: Basil Smash
cocktails.description: A fresh, herbaceous cocktail with gin, lemon juice, and basil—bright, zesty, and aromatic.
cocktails.instructions:
Muddle basil with lemon juice and simple syrup in a shaker.
Add gin and ice, then shake until well-chilled.
Strain into a rocks glass filled with ice.

cocktails.name: Bay Breeze
cocktails.description: A light and fruity mix of vodka, cranberry juice, and pineapple juice—refreshing and easy-drinking.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a highball glass with ice.
Add vodka, cranberry juice, and pineapple juice.
Stir gently and garnish with a lime wedge.

cocktails.name: Bee's Knees
cocktails.description: A Prohibition-era sour where honey softens gin’s botanicals. Bright lemon and floral sweetness land in perfect balance. Simple, elegant, and quietly luxurious.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Cocktail glass.
Shake gin, lemon juice, and honey syrup with ice.
Fine strain into the chilled glass.
Serve without garnish.

cocktails.name: Bellini
cocktails.description: A soft, fruity Italian spritz made with peach purée and sparkling wine. It’s light, elegant, and celebratory with a blush-pink hue. Perfect for brunch or a festive toast.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Champagne Flute.
Add peach purée to the bottom of the glass.
Slowly pour chilled prosecco over the purée.
Gently stir once, then serve.

cocktails.name: Bentley
cocktails.description: A rich, aromatic blend of apple brandy and Dubonnet Rouge with complex herbal and fruity notes, stirred and served straight up.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a mixing glass with ice.
Add apple brandy and Dubonnet Rouge.
Stir well until chilled.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with an orange peel.

cocktails.name: Between the Sheets
cocktails.description: A sharp, citrusy blend of cognac, rum, triple sec, and lemon juice. Smooth yet zesty, it balances rich and tangy notes with a warming spirit frame. Perfect for aperitif or after-dinner sipping.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Cocktail glass.
Shake all ingredients with ice.
Strain into the chilled glass.
No garnish required.

cocktails.name: Bible Belt
cocktails.instructions: Mix all ingredients, and pour over ice

cocktails.name: Big Red
cocktails.instructions: Pour ingredients into 1 ounce shot glass

cocktails.name: Bijou
cocktails.description: A jewel-toned spirit-forward blend of gin, Chartreuse, and sweet vermouth—herbal, aromatic, and balanced with a dash of bitters and a lemon twist or cherry garnish.
cocktails.instructions:
Stir gin, Chartreuse, vermouth, and bitters (if using) with ice until well-chilled.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist or maraschino cherry.

cocktails.name: Bird of Paradise
cocktails.description: A light, tropical long drink blending vodka (or rum variants), pineapple, lime, and simple syrup—for a fragrant, refreshing escape.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add all ingredients and shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Strain into a highball glass over fresh ice.
Garnish as desired (e.g., lemon slice or lychee).

cocktails.name: Black Russian
cocktails.description: A minimalist mix of vodka and coffee liqueur that drinks darker and richer than it looks. The sweetness of the liqueur softens the spirit’s edges without hiding it. Stirred over ice, it’s silky and quietly decadent.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Rocks glass.
Add vodka and coffee liqueur over fresh ice.
Stir briefly to chill and dilute.
Serve without garnish.

cocktails.name: Black Velvet
cocktails.description: A dramatic two-layered mix of stout and sparkling wine. Creamy malt meets crisp bubbles for a silky, bittersweet blend. Lush, festive, and surprisingly balanced.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Champagne Flute.
Half-fill the flute with chilled stout.
Gently top with sparkling wine.
Serve without garnish.

cocktails.name: Blood and Sand
cocktails.description: A unique Scotch-based cocktail harmonizing orange, cherry liqueur, and sweet vermouth. Complex, fruity, and silky with rich Scotch flavors. A smooth classic with dramatic name.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Cocktail glass.
Shake all ingredients with ice.
Strain into the chilled glass.
No garnish required.

cocktails.name: Bloody Mary
cocktails.description: Savory, spicy, and endlessly customizable, this brunch staple balances tomato, spice, and citrus. Vodka provides backbone while seasonings add complexity. Celery gives crunch and aroma.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Highball glass.
Build all ingredients over ice and roll between tins to mix.
Adjust seasoning to taste.
Garnish with a celery stalk.

cocktails.name: Blow Job
cocktails.description: A fun, creamy layered shooter of coffee liqueur and Irish cream, topped with whipped cream for a sweet finish.
cocktails.instructions:
Pour coffee liqueur into a shooter glass.
Carefully layer Irish cream over the back of a spoon.
Top with whipped cream.
Serve immediately.

cocktails.name: Blue Hawaiian
cocktails.description: A creamy tropical variation on the Blue Hawaii—rum, blue curaçao, pineapple juice, and coconut cream.
cocktails.instructions:
Shake rum, blue curaçao, pineapple juice, and coconut cream with ice.
Strain into a hurricane glass over ice.
Garnish with pineapple slice and cherry.

cocktails.name: Blue Kamikaze
cocktails.description: A vibrant blue shooter combining vodka, blue curaçao, and lime juice for a citrusy, sweet-tart kick.
cocktails.instructions:
Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice.
Shake well until chilled.
Strain into a shooter glass.
Serve immediately.

cocktails.name: Blue Lagoon
cocktails.description: Electric-blue and citrusy, this crowd-pleaser mixes vodka and curaçao with lemonade. Sweet-tart and sparkling, it drinks easy and looks festive. A party in a glass.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Highball glass.
Build vodka and curaçao over ice.
Top with lemonade and stir briefly.
Garnish with a lemon wedge.

cocktails.name: Blue Lagoon Margarita
cocktails.description: A hybrid of the Blue Lagoon and the Margarita—tequila, blue curaçao, and lemonade for a tangy, tropical twist.
cocktails.instructions:
Rim a margarita glass with salt.
Shake tequila and blue curaçao with ice.
Strain into the prepared glass filled with lemonade and ice.
Garnish with a lime wheel.

cocktails.name: Blue Margarita
cocktails.description: A colorful twist on the classic margarita, replacing triple sec with blue curaçao—citrusy, tropical, and eye-catching.
cocktails.instructions:
Rim a margarita glass with salt.
Shake tequila, blue curaçao, and lime juice with ice.
Strain into the prepared glass over fresh ice.
Garnish with a lime wheel.

cocktails.name: Blue Monday
cocktails.description: A bold and colorful vodka cocktail with blue curaçao and triple sec—citrusy, strong, and vibrant.
cocktails.instructions:
Shake vodka, triple sec, and blue curaçao with ice until chilled.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

cocktails.name: Blue Ocean
cocktails.description: A refreshing tropical cocktail blending rum, blue curaçao, and pineapple juice with a hint of coconut.
cocktails.instructions:
Add all ingredients except garnishes to a shaker with ice.
Shake well until chilled.
Strain into a hurricane glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a pineapple wedge and cherry.

cocktails.name: Blueberry Tea
cocktails.description: A warm, aromatic blend of Grand Marnier, Amaretto, and hot black tea, with a fruity and nutty profile.
cocktails.instructions:
Pour Grand Marnier and Amaretto into a warm Irish coffee glass.
Top with hot black tea.
Stir gently.
Garnish with an orange wedge.

cocktails.name: Bluebird
cocktails.instructions:
In a mixing glass half-filled with crushed ice, combine the gin, triple sec, Curacao, and bitters
Stir well
Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the lemon twist and the cherry

cocktails.name: BMW
cocktails.description: A layered shooter made with equal parts Baileys, Malibu, and whisky, offering creamy, coconut, and oaky notes.
cocktails.instructions:
Pour Baileys into a shooter glass.
Layer Malibu over the back of a spoon.
Layer whisky on top.
Serve immediately.

cocktails.name: Bob Marley
cocktails.instructions: Layer in a 2 oz shot glass or pony glass

cocktails.name: Bobby Burns
cocktails.description: A Scotch-and-vermouth classic sweetened with Benedictine. Rich, herbal, and warmly spiced with a long finish. A contemplative sipper for evening hours.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Cocktail glass.
Stir all ingredients with ice.
Strain into the chilled glass.
Optional lemon twist garnish.

cocktails.name: Bolo Cocktail
cocktails.description: A sophisticated mix of gin, dry vermouth, and apricot brandy, creating a balanced fruity yet crisp profile.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a mixing glass with ice.
Add gin, dry vermouth, and apricot brandy.
Stir well until chilled.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with an orange peel.

cocktails.name: Boomerang
cocktails.instructions:
In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, vermouth, bitters, and maraschino liqueur
Stir well
Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the cherry

cocktails.name: Bora Bora
cocktails.instructions:
Prepare in a blender or shaker, serve in a highball glass on the rocks
Garnish with 1 slice of pineapple and one cherry

cocktails.name: Boston Sour
cocktails.instructions:
Shake juice of lemon, powdered sugar, blended whiskey, and egg white with cracked ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass
Add the slice of lemon, top with the cherry, and serve

cocktails.name: Boulevardier
cocktails.description: A whiskey-forward cousin of the Negroni that trades gin for bourbon. Rich oak and vanilla notes soften the bitter edges while keeping the aperitivo character. Deep, warming, and ideal for cooler evenings.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Rocks glass.
Prepare garnish of orange twist.
Stir bourbon, Campari, and sweet vermouth with ice until well-chilled.
Strain over fresh ice in the glass.
Garnish with the orange twist.

cocktails.name: Boxcar
cocktails.instructions:
In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients
Shake well
Strain into a sour glass

cocktails.name: Boyarskiy
cocktails.description: A layered shooter of grenadine, vodka, and Tabasco sauce, delivering a sweet, fiery, and potent kick.
cocktails.instructions:
Pour grenadine into a shooter glass.
Gently layer vodka over the back of a spoon.
Top with Tabasco sauce.
Serve immediately.

cocktails.name: Brain Fart
cocktails.instructions:
Mix all ingredients together
Slowly and gently
Works best if ice is added to punch bowl and soda's are very cold

cocktails.name: Brain Tumor
cocktails.description: A visually striking layered shooter made with peach schnapps, Irish cream, and grenadine, creating a 'brain-like' effect.
cocktails.instructions:
Pour peach schnapps into a shooter glass.
Slowly layer Irish cream over the back of a spoon so it forms clumps.
Drop grenadine through the cream to create the visual effect.
Serve immediately.

cocktails.name: Bramble
cocktails.description: A refreshing and fruity gin cocktail with blackberry liqueur drizzled over the top. Citrus and sweetness balance the berry’s depth. Elegant, modern, and perfect for summer evenings.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Rocks glass.
Shake gin, lemon juice, and Simple Syrup with ice.
Strain over fresh crushed ice.
Drizzle blackberry liqueur over the top.

cocktails.name: Brandy Alexander
cocktails.description: A creamy dessert cocktail with brandy, crème de cacao, and cream—rich, smooth, and lightly chocolatey.
cocktails.instructions:
Shake brandy, crème de cacao, and cream with ice until well-chilled.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with grated nutmeg.

cocktails.name: Brandy Crusta
cocktails.description: A 19th‑century New Orleans classic with a sugared rim and citrus perfume. Cognac, curaçao, lemon, and bitters deliver bright intensity. It’s elegant, zesty, and theatrically garnished.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Cocktail glass.
Rim the glass with lemon and sugar, creating a crust.
Shake cognac, curaçao, lemon juice, and bitters with ice.
Strain into the prepared glass and garnish with a long lemon peel.

cocktails.name: Brandy Daisy
cocktails.description: A refreshing classic mixing brandy with lemon juice, orange liqueur, and grenadine for a balanced sweet-tart profile.
cocktails.instructions:
Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice.
Shake well until chilled.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon wedge.

cocktails.name: Brandy Eggnog
cocktails.description: A rich, creamy holiday classic blending brandy with milk, cream, sugar, and egg, topped with warming spices.
cocktails.instructions:
In a shaker, combine brandy, milk, cream, egg, and sugar.
Shake vigorously without ice to emulsify.
Add ice and shake again until well chilled.
Strain into a cup.
Garnish with a sprinkle of nutmeg.

cocktails.name: Brandy Separator
cocktails.description: A smooth, layered drink of brandy and coffee liqueur, served over ice for a rich, warming sipper.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a rocks glass with ice.
Pour brandy over the ice.
Carefully layer coffee liqueur over the back of a spoon so it settles beneath the brandy.
Serve without stirring.

cocktails.name: Brave Bull
cocktails.description: A simple, bold mix of tequila and coffee liqueur—smooth, rich, and warming.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a rocks glass with ice.
Add tequila and coffee liqueur.
Stir gently.

cocktails.name: Breakfast Martini
cocktails.description: A modern gin cocktail with triple sec, lemon juice, and orange marmalade—bright, citrusy, and slightly sweet.
cocktails.instructions:
Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice.
Shake until well-chilled.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

cocktails.name: Brigadier
cocktails.instructions: Mix ingredients in a warmed mug and stir

cocktails.name: Broadside
cocktails.instructions:
Half fill the glass with ice cubes
Crush the wormwood and add to ice
Pour rum, scotch and butters, then serve!

cocktails.name: Bronx
cocktails.description: A Martini cousin softened with sweet-and-dry vermouth and freshly pressed orange. Botanical, lightly sweet, and citrus-bright. An early 20th‑century staple.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Cocktail glass.
Shake all ingredients with ice.
Fine strain into the chilled glass.
No garnish required.

cocktails.name: Brooklyn
cocktails.instructions:
Combine ingredients with ice and stir until well-chilled
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass

cocktails.name: Brown Derby
cocktails.description: A bourbon-based cocktail with grapefruit juice and honey syrup—bright, tangy, and lightly sweet.
cocktails.instructions:
Shake bourbon, grapefruit juice, and honey syrup with ice until chilled.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

cocktails.name: Bubble Gum
cocktails.instructions: Layer in order into a shot glass

cocktails.name: Buccaneer
cocktails.instructions: Pour the corona into an 18oz beer glass pour the bacardi limon into the beer stir very gently

cocktails.name: Buck
cocktails.description: A refreshing family of highball drinks combining a base spirit with citrus juice and ginger ale, light and effervescent.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a highball glass with ice.
Add the base spirit and lemon juice.
Top with ginger ale.
Stir gently.
Garnish with a lemon wedge.

cocktails.name: Buck's Fizz
cocktails.description: A classic sparkling brunch cocktail mixing champagne with orange juice for a light, citrusy refreshment.
cocktails.instructions:
Pour chilled orange juice into a champagne flute.
Top with chilled champagne.
Garnish with an orange wedge.

cocktails.name: Bull Shot
cocktails.description: A savory, robust drink blending vodka with beef bouillon, Worcestershire sauce, and spices, served over ice.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a highball glass with ice.
Add vodka, beef bouillon, Worcestershire sauce, and Tabasco sauce.
Stir well to mix.
Garnish with freshly ground black pepper.

cocktails.name: Bullfrog
cocktails.description: A potent, citrusy cocktail mixing multiple spirits with lemon-lime soda for a dangerously smooth drink.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a hurricane glass with ice.
Add all spirits to the glass.
Top with lemon-lime soda.
Stir gently.
Garnish with a lemon wedge.

cocktails.name: Bumble Bee
cocktails.instructions:
This is a layered shot
First pour the Bailey's into the shot glass
Then take an upside down spoon and touch it to the inside wall of the glass
Carefully add the Kahlua
Repeat this process for the Sambuca
If done properly, the alcohol will stay separated and resemble a bumble bee
Enjoy!!!

cocktails.name: Bumbo
cocktails.description: A simple pirate-era drink of rum, sugar, water, and spices—sweet, warming, and historically rustic.
cocktails.instructions:
Dissolve sugar in a little water.
Add rum and remaining water, stir to mix.
Pour into a rocks glass over ice.
Top with a grating of nutmeg.

cocktails.name: Bushwacker
cocktails.description: A decadent, frozen tropical cocktail with rum, coffee liqueur, coconut cream, and chocolate liqueur, blended with ice for a boozy milkshake-like treat.
cocktails.instructions:
Add all ingredients except cherry to a blender with ice.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a hurricane glass.
Garnish with a cherry.

cocktails.name: Butter Cream
cocktails.description: A smooth and sweet dessert cocktail mixing butterscotch schnapps, Irish cream, and cream for a silky treat.
cocktails.instructions:
Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice.
Shake until well chilled and creamy.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a sprinkle of nutmeg.

cocktails.name: Buttery Nipple
cocktails.description: A sweet, layered shooter of butterscotch schnapps and Irish cream, with a rich, buttery flavor.
cocktails.instructions:
Pour butterscotch schnapps into a shooter glass.
Carefully layer Irish cream over the back of a spoon.
Serve immediately.

cocktails.name: Cafe Savoy
cocktails.instructions:
Fill mug almost to top with coffee
Add milk, triple sec and brandy
Stir

cocktails.name: Caipirinha
cocktails.description: Brazil’s national cocktail built with lime, sugar, and cachaça. Freshly muddled lime and sugar release oils and balancing sweetness. Serve over crushed ice for a rustic, invigorating highball.
cocktails.instructions:
Muddle lime quarters with sugar in a glass.
Add cachaça and fill with crushed ice.
Stir well and garnish with a lime wedge (optional).

cocktails.name: Caipirissima
cocktails.description: A Cuban spin on the Caipirinha using Cuban rum instead of cachaça. Lime and sugar deliver freshness, while rum adds depth and sugariness. Crushed ice makes it refreshingly cold.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Rocks glass.
Muddle lime quarters with sugar in the glass.
Add rum and crushed ice.
Stir gently to combine.

cocktails.name: Caipiroska
cocktails.description: A vodka-based twist on the Caipirinha, swapping cachaça for vodka. Fresh lime and sugar pulled into the spirit with crushed ice. Clean, zesty, and simple.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Rocks glass.
Muddle lime quarters with sugar in the glass.
Add vodka and crushed ice.
Stir gently to mix.

cocktails.name: California Root Beer
cocktails.description: A cocktail that mimics the flavor of root beer by combining coffee liqueur, Galliano, and cola over ice.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a highball glass with ice.
Add coffee liqueur and Galliano.
Top with cola.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

cocktails.name: Campari Beer
cocktails.instructions:
Use a 15 oz glass
Add Campari first
Fill with beer

cocktails.name: Campari Gin Tonic
cocktails.description: A bittersweet and aromatic variation of the gin and tonic, featuring the bold flavor of Campari alongside gin and tonic water.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a highball glass with ice.
Pour in gin and Campari.
Top with tonic water.
Stir gently and garnish with an orange slice.

cocktails.name: Campari Spritz
cocktails.description: A vibrant spritz that showcases Campari with prosecco and soda. Bitter, fizzy, and refreshing with a beautiful coral hue. Perfect aperitivo for hot afternoons.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Wine glass.
Pour Campari, then prosecco over ice.
Top with soda and stir gently.
Garnish with an orange slice.

cocktails.name: Canary Flip
cocktails.description: A rich, creamy cocktail made with sherry, egg yolk, and sugar, offering a smooth texture and nutty-sweet flavor.
cocktails.instructions:
Add sherry, egg yolk, and sugar to a shaker without ice.
Shake vigorously until frothy.
Add ice and shake again until chilled.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a sprinkle of nutmeg.

cocktails.name: Canchanchara
cocktails.description: An old Cuban refresher of rum, lime, honey, and water. Light, rustic, and gently sweet with bright citrus. Built over ice for effortless sipping.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Rocks glass.
Add honey and lime juice, then rum; stir to dissolve.
Add ice and top with a splash of water.
Briefly stir and serve.

cocktails.name: Cantaritos
cocktails.description: A refreshing Mexican cocktail with tequila, citrus juices, and grapefruit soda, traditionally served in a clay cup.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a clay cup or highball glass with ice.
Add tequila, orange juice, lemon juice, and lime juice.
Top with grapefruit soda.
Stir gently.
Garnish with a lime wedge; optionally rim the cup with salt.

cocktails.name: Cape Cod
cocktails.description: A simple, refreshing mix of vodka and cranberry juice, garnished with lime for a tart finish.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a highball glass with ice.
Add vodka and top with cranberry juice.
Stir gently.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

cocktails.name: Car Crash
cocktails.description: A layered shooter combining peppermint schnapps and coffee liqueur for a bold, minty-sweet kick.
cocktails.instructions:
Pour peppermint schnapps into a shooter glass.
Carefully layer coffee liqueur over the back of a spoon.
Serve immediately.

cocktails.name: Caribou Lou
cocktails.description: A tropical party drink made with rum, pineapple juice, and coconut rum, smooth and sweet.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a highball glass with ice.
Add 151 proof rum and coconut rum.
Top with pineapple juice.
Stir gently and serve.

cocktails.name: Casa Blanca
cocktails.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve

cocktails.name: Casino
cocktails.description: An early 1900s gem of equal parts gin and maraschino complemented by lemon and bitters. Bright, floral, and sophisticated with a touch of sweetness. A delicate yet resolved pre-dinner cocktail.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Cocktail glass.
Shake gin, maraschino, lemon juice, and bitters with ice.
Strain into the chilled glass.
Garnish with a maraschino cherry and a lemon twist (optional).

cocktails.name: Casino Royale
cocktails.instructions:
In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients
Shake well
Strain into a sour glass

cocktails.name: Champagne Cocktail
cocktails.description: A simple, elegant cocktail that adds bitters and sugar to sparkling wine. Sweet, aromatic, and effervescent, with just a whisper of bitters’ complexity. Perfect for celebrations.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Champagne Flute.
Place the sugar cube in the glass and douse with bitters.
Slowly pour sparkling wine over it.
No garnish required.

cocktails.name: Champs Elysees
cocktails.description: A sophisticated blend of cognac, green Chartreuse, lemon juice, and bitters for a herbal, citrusy classic.
cocktails.instructions:
Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice.
Shake well until chilled.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon peel.

cocktails.name: Charlie Chaplin
cocktails.description: A classic Prohibition-era cocktail combining sloe gin, apricot brandy, and lime juice for a balanced fruity and tart flavor.
cocktails.instructions:
Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice.
Shake well until chilled.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

cocktails.name: Cherry Hooker
cocktails.description: A sweet layered shooter with grenadine, coffee liqueur, and Irish cream for a cherry, coffee, and cream taste.
cocktails.instructions:
Pour grenadine into a shooter glass.
Layer coffee liqueur over the back of a spoon.
Layer Irish cream on top.
Garnish with a cherry.

cocktails.name: Cherry Rum
cocktails.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve

cocktails.name: Chestnut Manhattan
cocktails.description: Indulge in the sophisticated flavours of a Chestnut Manhattan. A smooth and nutty take on a classic, it's the perfect way to elevate your Cocktail game.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Build all ingredients in a mixing glass and stir over ice until chilled.
2. Pour into a chilled glass and garnish with a cherry.

cocktails.name: Chicago Fizz
cocktails.instructions:
Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes
Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve

cocktails.name: Chilcano de Pisco
cocktails.description: A refreshing Peruvian cocktail made with pisco, ginger ale, lime juice, and bitters, light and citrusy with a spicy ginger note.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a highball glass with ice.
Add pisco and lime juice.
Top with ginger ale and add bitters.
Stir gently.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

cocktails.name: Chocolate Drink
cocktails.instructions:
Melt the bar in a small amount of milk
Add more milk
Cook over low heat, stiring gently until heated well.
Don't let it boil! Serve in a mug

cocktails.name: Chocolate Espresso Martini
cocktails.description: A decadent twist on the espresso martini, with chocolate notes and rich coffee flavor.
cocktails.instructions:
Shake vodka, coffee liqueur, espresso, and chocolate syrup with ice.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with chocolate shavings or coffee beans.

cocktails.name: Chocolate Milk
cocktails.instructions:
Put the milk in the bottom, pour the Liquer on top and add the dash of amaretto
Do not mix
SLAM IT!

cocktails.name: Chupacabra
cocktails.description: A bold, spicy cocktail combining tequila, Tabasco sauce, and lime juice for a fiery kick.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a rocks glass with ice.
Add tequila and lime juice.
Top with Tabasco sauce.
Stir briefly.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

cocktails.name: Citrus Coke
cocktails.instructions:
Pour half of coke in a glass
Then add Bacardi and top it off with the remaining coke
Stir and drink up!

cocktails.name: City Slicker
cocktails.instructions:
In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients
Shake well
Strain into a cocktail glass

cocktails.name: Clove Cocktail
cocktails.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve

cocktails.name: Clover Club
cocktails.description: A pre-Prohibition classic made with gin, lemon juice, raspberry syrup, and egg white for a silky, fruity, and tart cocktail.
cocktails.instructions:
Add all ingredients to a shaker without ice and dry shake to emulsify.
Add ice and shake again until well chilled.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Serve without garnish or with a small raspberry.

cocktails.name: Coke and Drops
cocktails.instructions:
Take a glass, pour the Coke in the glass, then you take 2 teaspoons of lemon juice
Granish with a lemon slice on the rim of the glass

cocktails.name: Colorado Bulldog
cocktails.description: A playful twist on the White Russian, adding cola to vodka, coffee liqueur, and milk—creamy, fizzy, and smooth.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a highball glass with ice.
Add vodka, coffee liqueur, and milk.
Top with cola and stir gently.

cocktails.name: Contessa
cocktails.description: A lighter, more floral take on the Negroni, with gin, Aperol, and dry vermouth—bitter-sweet and aromatic.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a rocks glass with ice.
Add gin, Aperol, and dry vermouth.
Stir gently and garnish with an orange slice.

cocktails.name: Copenhagen 1939
cocktails.description: A Danish-inspired cocktail with gin, sweet vermouth, and cherry liqueur—fruity, herbal, and rich.
cocktails.instructions:
Stir all ingredients with ice until chilled.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

cocktails.name: Corn n Oil
cocktails.instructions:
Cut the half lime in half again
Add the lime, falernum, and bitters to a rocks glass
Muddle
Add the rum
(Aged Barbados rum such as Plantation 5 Year is recommended)
Add ice and stir
Float the blackstrap rum on top
Serve with a straw

cocktails.name: Corpse Reviver
cocktails.instructions: Shake, strain, straight up, cocktail glass rinsed with absinthe

cocktails.name: Corpse Reviver #2
cocktails.description: A classic restorative cocktail blending gin, Cointreau, Lillet Blanc, and a touch of absinthe. Bright, herbal, and citrusy with a hint of anise. A sophisticated pick-me-up.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Cocktail glass.
Shake all ingredients with ice until well-chilled.
Fine strain into the chilled glass.
Optional lemon twist garnish.

cocktails.name: Corpse Reviver No. 2
cocktails.description: An equal-parts classic with gin, lemon, Cointreau, and Lillet, kissed by absinthe. Zesty, floral, and perfectly balanced. Designed as a bracing pick‑me‑up.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Cocktail glass.
Rinse the glass with absinthe and discard excess (optional).
Shake remaining ingredients with ice.
Fine strain into the glass; no garnish required.

cocktails.name: Cosmopolitan
cocktails.description: Crisp and tart with flashes of orange and cranberry, this 1990s icon remains a crowd-pleaser. Vodka Citron adds zesty lift. Served up for a sleek, refreshing finish.
cocktails.instructions:
Select and pre-chill a Cocktail glass.
Shake all ingredients with ice.
Fine strain into the chilled glass.
Express an orange twist over the surface and garnish.

cocktails.name: Cranberry Punch
cocktails.instructions:
Combine first four ingredients
Stir until sugar is dissolved, chill
Then add ginger ale just before serving
Add ice ring to keep punch cold

cocktails.name: Cranberry Punch (N/A)
cocktails.instructions:
Combine first four ingredients
Stir until sugar is dissolved, chill
Then add ginger ale just before serving
Add ice ring to keep punch cold

cocktails.name: Cream Soda
cocktails.instructions:
Pour 1oz of Spiced Rum into a highball glass with ice
Fill with Ginger Ale

cocktails.name: Creamsicle
cocktails.description: A creamy, sweet drink combining orange juice, vanilla vodka, triple sec, and cream for a nostalgic dessert flavor.
cocktails.instructions:
Fill a highball glass with ice.
Add vodka, triple sec, and orange juice.
Top with cream and stir gently.
Garnish with an orange wedge.

cocktails.name: Creme Anglaise
cocktails.description: A dessert-style cocktail with vanilla vodka, white crème de cacao, and cream, evoking the flavor of the classic custard sauce.
cocktails.instructions:
Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice.
Shake well until chilled and creamy.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a sprinkle of nutmeg.

cocktails.name: Crimson Cranberry Punch
cocktails.description: This bright coloured crowd-pleaser is sure to make any holiday get together even better.
cocktails.instructions: Build all ingredients together in a punch bowl. Garnish with lemon wheels, orange wheels and cranberries. Serve in rocks glasses chilled over ice.

cocktails.name: Cuba Libra
cocktails.instructions:
Fill tall glass with ice cubes
Add rum
Rub cut edge of lime on rim of glass then squeeze juice into glass
Fill with Coca-Cola
Garnish with lime slice
Enjoy!

cocktails.name: Cuba Libre
